title: Is there any search engine information that shows ‘unfulfilled’ searches i.e. where none of the websites showing from a search are ‘clicked’ on? - Quora

response.answer_text: Finding under served keywords If you are trying to figure this type of information out you will need to use a search engine keyword research tool. You are looking for low competition under served keywords, which means that you want to see a keyword that has been searched but not being targeted by blogs or websites. By using a tool it will expose how many sites have used the all in title result.  How do you do this manually? You can do this manually by typing (allintitle: _______) into the google search box. The underline I have noted above is where you place your keyword after. A great way of finding words like this manually is to use Doug cunningtons KGR method. heres a video on this method below I hope this could be of help. If you found this useful then I encourage you to follow me for more.
